commenter_b: when people are in the process of migrating from one spot to another they are sometimes referred to as migrants.
commenter_a: because it describes a particular group of people. Like descibing a group of people from Norway as Norwegian or whatever. jeez
post_message: "You will still see the word 'migrants' or 'migration' in the Guardian as a general expression to cover people who for whatever reason have moved, or are moving, from the country of which they are nationals to another. But 'refugees', 'displaced people' and 'asylum seekers', all of which have clear definitions, are more useful and accurate terms than a catch-all label like 'migrants', and we should use them wherever possible." - David Marsh, Guardian style guide editor.
